result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert Aaron Zahn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain absolute sobriety.  No alcohol.  May not possess or consume any controlled substances unless prescribed by a medical professional.  May not enter any bars, taverns or establishments where the primary source of revenue is the sale of alcohol.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert Aaron Zahn

records.addlTxt: 11:33 AM Prosecuting attorney Emmeline Lee in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Robert Aaron Zahn appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Walter H Isaacson appeared by video for Robert Aaron Zahn. Defendant waives right to appear in person in courtroom. Defendant pleads guilty; Court finds defendant guilty.  Defendant waives right to pre sentence investigation. Court orders sentence withheld, 12 months probation consecutive to 21CT419, any treatment deemed necessary, maintain absolute sobriety, no alcohol, may not possess or consume any controlled substances unless prescribed by a medical professional, may not enter any bars, taverns or establishments where the primary source of revenue is the sale of alcohol. costs due to Clerk of Court, 0 days sentence credit.
Notice of Hearing Plea/sentencing July 27, 2022 at 11:30am   NOT DELIVERABLE AS ADDRESSED, UNABLE TO FORWARD, RETURN TO SENDER (Robert Aaron Zahn)
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 27, 2022 at 11:30 am.

08:49 AM Defendant Robert A Zahn in court, by video means, in custody at the Rock County Jail and with attorney Walter H Isaacson in person.  Kyle Edward Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin in person.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Calendar call on June 6, 2022 at 08:45 am.

Activity: Initial Appearance
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

01:30 PM Defendant Robert Aaron Zahn in court by video means and with attorney Walter H Isaacson by video means.  Emmeline Lee  and Intern Margaret Ginocchio appeared for the State of Wisconsin by video means.   Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived.  Signature bond of $1000 set, absolute sobriety. Defendant to sign bond tomorrow.   Defendant pleads not guilty and jury trial to be set.
Initial appearance on January 31, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
